properties.name: focused
properties.description: If true, the element currently has focus.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description:
Set to true to disable this input. If you're using PaperInputBehavior to
implement your own paper-input-like element, bind this to
both the `<paper-input-container>`'s and the input's `disabled` property.

properties.name: keyEventTarget
properties.description:
The EventTarget that will be firing relevant KeyboardEvents. Set it to
`null` to disable the listeners.

properties.name: stopKeyboardEventPropagation
properties.description:
If true, this property will cause the implementing element to
automatically stop propagation on any handled KeyboardEvents.

properties.name: label
properties.description:
The label for this input. If you're using PaperInputBehavior to
implement your own paper-input-like element, bind this to
`<label>`'s content and `hidden` property, e.g.
`<label hidden$="[[!label]]">[[label]]</label>` in your `template`

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value for this element.

properties.name: invalid
properties.description:
Returns true if the value is invalid. If you're using PaperInputBehavior to
implement your own paper-input-like element, bind this to both the
`<paper-input-container>`'s and the input's `invalid` property.

If `autoValidate` is true, the `invalid` attribute is managed automatically,
which can clobber attempts to manage it manually.

properties.name: allowedPattern
properties.description:
Set this to specify the pattern allowed by `preventInvalidInput`. If
you're using PaperInputBehavior to implement your own paper-input-like
element, bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `allowedPattern`
property.

properties.name: type
properties.description:
The type of the input. The supported types are the
[native input's types](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#Form_<input>_types).
If you're using PaperInputBehavior to implement your own paper-input-like element,
bind this to the (Polymer 1) `<input is="iron-input">`'s or (Polymer 2)
`<iron-input>`'s `type` property.

properties.name: list
properties.description:
The datalist of the input (if any). This should match the id of an existing `<datalist>`.
If you're using PaperInputBehavior to implement your own paper-input-like
element, bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `list` property.

properties.name: pattern
properties.description:
A pattern to validate the `input` with. If you're using PaperInputBehavior to
implement your own paper-input-like element, bind this to
the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `pattern` property.

properties.name: required
properties.description:
Set to true to mark the input as required. If used in a form, a
custom element that uses this behavior should also use
Polymer.IronValidatableBehavior and define a custom validation method.
Otherwise, a `required` element will always be considered valid.
It's also strongly recommended to provide a visual style for the element
when its value is invalid.

properties.name: errorMessage
properties.description:
The error message to display when the input is invalid. If you're using
PaperInputBehavior to implement your own paper-input-like element,
bind this to the `<paper-input-error>`'s content, if using.

properties.name: charCounter
properties.description: Set to true to show a character counter.

properties.name: noLabelFloat
properties.description:
Set to true to disable the floating label. If you're using PaperInputBehavior to
implement your own paper-input-like element, bind this to
the `<paper-input-container>`'s `noLabelFloat` property.

properties.name: alwaysFloatLabel
properties.description:
Set to true to always float the label. If you're using PaperInputBehavior to
implement your own paper-input-like element, bind this to
the `<paper-input-container>`'s `alwaysFloatLabel` property.

properties.name: autoValidate
properties.description:
Set to true to auto-validate the input value. If you're using PaperInputBehavior to
implement your own paper-input-like element, bind this to
the `<paper-input-container>`'s `autoValidate` property.

properties.name: validator
properties.description:
Name of the validator to use. If you're using PaperInputBehavior to
implement your own paper-input-like element, bind this to
the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `validator` property.

properties.name: autocomplete
properties.description:
If you're using PaperInputBehavior to implement your own paper-input-like
element, bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `autocomplete` property.

properties.name: autofocus
properties.description:
If you're using PaperInputBehavior to implement your own paper-input-like
element, bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `autofocus` property.

properties.name: inputmode
properties.description:
If you're using PaperInputBehavior to implement your own paper-input-like
element, bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `inputmode` property.

properties.name: minlength
properties.description:
The minimum length of the input value.
If you're using PaperInputBehavior to implement your own paper-input-like
element, bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `minlength` property.

properties.name: maxlength
properties.description:
The maximum length of the input value.
If you're using PaperInputBehavior to implement your own paper-input-like
element, bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `maxlength` property.

properties.name: min
properties.description:
The minimum (numeric or date-time) input value.
If you're using PaperInputBehavior to implement your own paper-input-like
element, bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `min` property.

properties.name: max
properties.description:
The maximum (numeric or date-time) input value.
Can be a String (e.g. `"2000-01-01"`) or a Number (e.g. `2`).
If you're using PaperInputBehavior to implement your own paper-input-like
element, bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `max` property.

properties.name: step
properties.description:
Limits the numeric or date-time increments.
If you're using PaperInputBehavior to implement your own paper-input-like
element, bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `step` property.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of this element.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: A placeholder string in addition to the label. If this is set, the label will always float.

properties.name: readonly
properties.description:
If you're using PaperInputBehavior to implement your own paper-input-like
element, bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `readonly` property.

properties.name: size
properties.description:
If you're using PaperInputBehavior to implement your own paper-input-like
element, bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `size` property.

properties.name: autocapitalize
properties.description:
If you're using PaperInputBehavior to implement your own paper-input-like
element, bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `autocapitalize` property.

properties.name: autocorrect
properties.description:
If you're using PaperInputBehavior to implement your own paper-input-like
element, bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `autocorrect` property.

properties.name: autosave
properties.description:
If you're using PaperInputBehavior to implement your own paper-input-like
element, bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `autosave` property,
used with type=search.

properties.name: results
properties.description:
If you're using PaperInputBehavior to implement your own paper-input-like
element, bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `results` property,
used with type=search.

properties.name: accept
properties.description:
If you're using PaperInputBehavior to implement your own paper-input-like
element, bind this to the `<input is="iron-input">`'s `accept` property,
used with type=file.

properties.name: multiple
properties.description:
If you're using PaperInputBehavior to implement your own paper-input-like
element, bind this to the`<input is="iron-input">`'s `multiple` property,
used with type=file.

properties.name: rows
properties.description: The initial number of rows.

properties.name: maxRows
properties.description:
The maximum number of rows this element can grow to until it
scrolls. 0 means no maximum.

methods.name: addOwnKeyBinding
methods.description:
Can be used to imperatively add a key binding to the implementing
element. This is the imperative equivalent of declaring a keybinding
in the `keyBindings` prototype property.

methods.name: removeOwnKeyBindings
methods.description: When called, will remove all imperatively-added key bindings.

methods.name: keyboardEventMatchesKeys
methods.description: Returns true if a keyboard event matches `eventString`.

methods.name: inputElement
methods.description: Returns a reference to the input element.

methods.name: validate
methods.description: Validates the input element and sets an error style if needed.

methods.name: updateValueAndPreserveCaret
methods.description: Restores the cursor to its original position after updating the value.

parameters.name: newValue
parameters.description: The value that should be saved.
